chargeHist.descr: Injury by Use of Vehicle with PAC

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15) and Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15). The defendant was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15) and the other charge, Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jordan D. Cooney was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay fine plus costs
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
*Maintain absolute sobriety during period of probation

Defendant Jordan D. Cooney in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CF50 and 15TR3320
2:32 p.m.  Amended Information filed by the State.

2:46 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF50:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI

15TR3320:  DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 16CF50 and Count 2 is DRI and 15TR3320 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification. 
Atty Wallace makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a brief statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 24 months -
**Conditions of Probation:
100 days of conditional jail - granted huber priviliges and eligible for GPS electronic home monitoring for 1/2 of the time, if approved by jail adminiatration
4 days jail credit 
60 days to commence jail sentence

Pay fine of $1,200 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
24 month DL revocation
24 month IID, on any vehicles owned by the defendant
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety during period of probation.
Pay restitution - State would request 30 days to verify if there is restitution to be paid and the amount, if applicable - determination withheld 

Count 2 - Dismissed
